page.title: 13QUEEN ELIZABETH GRAMMAR SCH.
page.content: The school was founded in 1591. In 1854 it moved from its original site near the market place to occupy the premises of the defunct Wakefield Proprietary Scool in Northgate. The buildings were extended in 1891 and 1910. A junior school was also added. Extra classrooms and laboratories were built in 1952 and the Queen Elizabeth Hall in 1958. Further rooms were added in 1959, a new gym in 1960 and the Baggaley Building in 1973. A sixth form centre and music block were opened in 1979 and additional space for art,computing and CDT in 1982. There are 880 boys (170 juniors, 710 seniors) in school, drawn mainly from West and South Yorkshire. Formerly a Direct Grant school, it went independent in 1976 and since 1981 has been involved in the adjusted places scheme. N.RIGBY
